page.title: 01MARCHAM: LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
MARCHAM is a small village in the Thames valley. It has a population of 1673 today, and has grown a lot since the end of the Second World War. There are several new estates built on the north and east of the original village.
The village appears in the Domesday Book under the name of {Merceham}: "The Abbey of Abingdon itself holds Merceham. A church is there...and a mill." A church is still there, as is the mill. In our research for this program we talked to the vicar and visited the mill; the church is still central to the life of the village, and we could still see the bones of the 1086 village of Merceham showing through the 1986 village of Marcham.
